verses.text: When Rehoboam came to Jerusalem, he assembled the house of Judah and Benjamin, one hundred eighty thousand chosen warriors, to fight against Israel, to restore the kingdom to Rehoboam son of Solomon.
verses.comment: Maintains the original mention of both Judah and Benjamin, and the specific number of warriors.

verses.text: But the word of the LORD came to Shemaiah the man of God:
verses.comment: Shemaiah is identified as 'the man of God' as in the original Hebrew.

verses.text: "Speak to Rehoboam son of Solomon, king of Judah, and to all Israel in Judah and Benjamin, saying,
verses.comment: Direct speech; keeps the address to all Israel in Judah and Benjamin.

verses.text: 'This is what the LORD says: You shall not go up or fight against your brothers. Return every man to his house, for this matter is from me.' So they listened to the words of the LORD and turned back from marching against Jeroboam.
verses.comment: ‘This is what the LORD says’ reflects Hebrew construction; maintains the causation from God.

verses.text: Rehoboam lived in Jerusalem and built cities for defense in Judah.
verses.comment: The list of cities follows in subsequent verses.

verses.text: He built up Bethlehem, Etam, Tekoa,
verses.comment: City list taken directly; order matches Hebrew.

verses.text: Beth-zur, Soco, Adullam,
Gath, Mareshah, Ziph,
Adoraim, Lachish, Azekah,
Zorah, Aijalon, and Hebron, fortified cities that are in Judah and Benjamin.
verses.comment: Includes Hebron and notes location in Judah and Benjamin.

verses.text: He strengthened the fortresses and placed commanders in them, along with stores of food, oil, and wine.
verses.comment: Follows Hebrew word order; ‘commanders’ for ‘leaders’ or ‘officers’.

verses.text: He put shields and spears in every city and made them exceedingly strong. So Judah and Benjamin belonged to him.
verses.comment: Translates 'exceedingly strong' as ‘very great’ in some versions.

verses.text: And the priests and the Levites who were in all Israel stood with him, leaving their lands to come to him.
verses.comment: Maintains the action of religious leaders abandoning property for Rehoboam.

verses.text: For the Levites left their pastures and their possessions and came to Judah and Jerusalem, because Jeroboam and his sons had cast them out from serving as priests for the LORD.
verses.comment: Explains the motive for the Levites’ departure.

verses.text: Jeroboam appointed his own priests for the high places, for the goat idols, and for the calves that he had made.
verses.comment: 'Goat idols' follows Hebrew 'seirim' rather than 'devils' or 'demons'.

verses.text: And those from all the tribes of Israel who set their hearts to seek the LORD, the God of Israel, came to Jerusalem to sacrifice to the LORD, the God of their fathers.
They strengthened the kingdom of Judah and supported Rehoboam son of Solomon for three years, for they walked in the way of David and Solomon for three years.
verses.comment: Maintains reference to walking in David and Solomon’s ways.

verses.text: Rehoboam took as wife Mahalath, the daughter of Jerimoth, son of David, and of Abihail, the daughter of Eliab, son of Jesse.
verses.comment: Clarifies both maternal and paternal lineage.

verses.text: She bore him sons: Jeush, Shemariah, and Zaham.
After her, he married Maacah daughter of Absalom, who bore him Abijah, Attai, Ziza, and Shelomith.
verses.comment: ‘Daughter of Absalom’ is literal; possibly granddaughter.

verses.text: Now Rehoboam loved Maacah daughter of Absalom more than all his other wives and concubines. He took eighteen wives and sixty concubines, and fathered twenty-eight sons and sixty daughters.
verses.comment: Numbers match Masoretic Text; ‘fathered’ is plain modern English.

verses.text: Rehoboam appointed Abijah the son of Maacah as chief, leader among his brothers, for he intended to make him king.
verses.comment: 'Chief, leader among his brothers' communicates Hebrew 'head' (nagid).

verses.text: He dealt wisely and distributed some of his sons throughout all the districts of Judah and Benjamin, to every fortified city. He gave them abundant provisions and found many wives for them.
verses.comment: ‘He dealt wisely’ conveys the Hebrew idiom.
